SEARCH
Package com.rikuthin.entities

Class MobileEntity

java.lang.Object
com.rikuthin.entities.Entity
com.rikuthin.entities.MobileEntity
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable, Updateable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bullet, Enemy, Player
public abstract class MobileEntity extends Entity
Represents a mobile entity in the game that can move around the game world. Extends the Entity class to add movement-related behavior.

  • Field Details

    • velocityX

      protected double velocityX
      The movement speed of the entity along the x-axis, in pixels per frame.

      Uses the Cartesian coordinate system:

      • A negative value moves the entity to the left.
      • A positive value moves the entity to the right.

    • velocityY

      protected double velocityY
      The movement speed of the entity along the y-axis, in pixels per frame.

      Uses the Cartesian coordinate system:

      • A negative value moves the entity upwards.
      • A positive value moves the entity downwards.

  • Constructor Details

    • MobileEntity

      protected MobileEntity(MobileEntity.MobileEntityBuilder<?> builder)
      Private constructor used by the builder pattern to instantiate a MobileEntity.
      Parameters:
      builder - The builder used to construct the entity.

  • Method Details

    • getVelocityX

      public double getVelocityX()
      Returns the movement speed of the entity along the x-axis in pixels per frame.

      Uses the Cartesian coordinate system (i.e., -x moves left, +x moves left).

      Returns:
      The speed.

    • getVelocityY

      public double getVelocityY()
      Returns the movement speed of the entity along the y-axis in pixels per frame.

      Uses the Cartesian coordinate system (i.e., -y moves down, +x moves up).

      Returns:
      The speed.

    • setVelocityX

      public void setVelocityX(double velocityX)
      Sets the movement speed of the entity along the x-axis in pixels per frame.

      Uses the Cartesian coordinate system (i.e., -x moves left, +x moves left).

      Parameters:
      velocityX - The movement speed along the x-axis

    • setVelocityY

      public void setVelocityY(double velocityY)
      Returns the movement speed of the entity along the y-axis in pixels per frame.

      Uses the Cartesian coordinate system (i.e., -y moves down, +x moves up).

      Parameters:
      velocityY - The movement speed along the y-axis

    • move

      public void move()
      Updates the enntity's current position using their current movement speed values for the x and y axes.

      Automatically converts the Cartesian velocity modifiers to be compatible with screen-coordinates.
